title: Seasonal Reader (Office of Undergraduate Admission) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Great communication and professionalism. Zoom interview was thorough but relaxing and interviewers were open to any questions. Follow up email questions were answered promptly. Also, provided a schedule when offers would be sent and adhered to that, which I always appreciate.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Toured research lab and spoke to current students about their projects and work. I also met with the professor who leads the lab. I was impressed with the facilities they have.
Interview Questions: What research subjects interest me?

title: HR- Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The interview for an HR job was very professional and everyone was so nice. I hope this reflects the way HR conducts themselves in general. They are also using a really cool online video interview system called HireVue that was really convenient.
Interview Questions: They asked traditional questions about strengths and weaknesses, but with a focus on innovation and technology.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Organized and helpful, kept it to get point. Stayed in contact to keep me updated and aware. All people involved were kind and respectful. There was no ambiguity in the entire interview process.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview questions and overall a smooth interview process. I was invited to a lab setting and interviewed with current lab mates and then the professor/ researcher. I was asked different behavioral questions and technical questions regarding the skills they desired.
Interview Questions: What is your professional strength?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Pretty smooth interview. Company is a father son owned. They have several companies in surrounding cities. They offer relocation and remote offices. Waiting to hear back to see if I get the job. Tasks are really simple just answering phone.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to relocate

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: IT was an online interview with about 10 questions. I had to introduce my research experiences and my published journal papers. Research interests and plans are also asked. After the interview, I just waited. It takes about 1~2 week to receive the offer.
Interview Questions: Introduce Yourself. Introduce your research experience. What research do you want to proceed with in the future?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple and casual. The manager really cared about how I would fit in as well as my aptitude for the position and personality traits. At the time of hire, many other candidates were considered. I had to take an assessment / test.
Interview Questions: The cared more about how I would fit with the team.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: First Screening was on the basis of CV, and then a short casual interview on past experiences and why I would be interested in working on the project at hand
Interview Questions: Describe what you did in (one particular) past project

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Four-stage process. One pre-screen with hiring manager, one panel interview with prepared 5-min presentation on a question they posed, one final interview with hiring manager and hiring manager's manager, and one in-person lunch (not a formal interview, but who are we kidding?)
Interview Questions: Advanced Question: Measuring Project Success: Provide an example of a prior experience where you developed and implemented "novel" accountability metrics (KPIs) to measure a project's performance, success, and/or impacts. What was the process used to determine what was to be measured and how was the implementation process introduced? Follow-Up 1: What accountability tactics were put in place to identify any needed adjustments in the process once launched? Follow-Up 2: How did you contribute to successfully communicating the metrics/results to the project sponsor?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: An online application was due in early December. This was followed by a Zoom interview in early January. In person visit in March. Decisions were expected by mid April with decision coming out just after the in person interview
Interview Questions: What is your motivation for grad school?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: It was somewhat challenging. Very fast-paced interview. Lots of questions, but they are manageable. We did a virtual consultation, then we did an in-person interview that also counted as a walkthrough.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to work together as a team and use critical thinking to solve a problem.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Not easy I had to show my understanding of how to link and connect with different people . It was hard at first to get to understand what is needed of me.
Interview Questions: What is the best way for you to maintain a contact?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I was already working for credits with Gatech. I requested to work during the summer and get paid. Based on the skills I had and recommendations, I got the interview.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have and how many hours can you spend on the project/research

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions:
Simple interview about previous experience with class material and grade in class. 

Very nice staff involved, but Human Resources is a bit slow for first hire. I did not get paid until second half of the semester
Interview Questions: What are some of your previous experience

title: Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Simple setup with Zoom interview. Kept it professional but stress free. No crazy or standard interview questions just specific about candidate and position and how well you would fit. Made you feel comfortable and untrusted.
Interview Questions: Prefer to work alone or as a team.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application in mid september, talked with program director and professors independent of application then had phone call and email communication in late december, In person interview early February
Interview Questions: What are your goals in this program? How are you going to build on your previous skills here?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: A zoom interview with the lab manager and phd students assisting on the research. The interview lasted 30 minutes in length. It was very short and I was told I would hear back. I never heard from the lab manager again.
Interview Questions: How long can you work in this position? (Want students to work a year)

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process. Everyone is very nice and will help you throughout the process. It is normally only one interview and only 15-20 minutes long. I would highly recommend interviewing for a position here.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: One round- pretty short. It was a very short interview with the person asking my skills and previous experience, took a week to get back to me. Got the offer!
Interview Questions: What year do you graduate?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Really positive and a loving environment, very easy to talk to and easy to answer questions, really enjoyed being able to interview and learn more about the process and duties of being an office assistant
Interview Questions: What do you want from being an office assistant?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Interview was virtual, I presented my self introduction, went into a review of job requirements, the interview was really simple and straightforward.  Interview went over job duties. Discussed work availabilities.
Interview Questions: Work Schedule, Previous work experience

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: A series of 30 min interviews with 3-5 professors within the department spanning  various topics in biological and life sciences. In depth conversation on previous work experiences and transferable skill set. Review of publication record and academic performance.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experiments and how you if you have had to troubleshoot a protocol.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Not too hard. Interview with university professor. Asked about my background and also some technical questions for the subject I was applying. Got an offer after some more personality interviews.
Interview Questions: Don't know if I am allowed to say.

title: Customer Service Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was Calvin and Richard. They had no clue about call center and were uninterested in interviewing me both were on the phone when doing the interview with me. They were not engaged at all.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working from home?

title: Behavioral Health Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Meet with allied health professionals, the mental health professional, Director. Typical questions ask of licensed doctors. to include questions around ethics boundaries, mandated reporting and resources.  Understanding of DSM-5, diagnosis, assessment ...........
Interview Questions: Inquired about off-hours availability for crisis

title: Mechanical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The process was Very upfront, professional and easy to complete. The whole process was very inviting however I decided not to relocate due to personal family needs. Would apply again should my career path direct me to Ga again.
Interview Questions: Years of experience and reason for applying.

title: Member Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Manager will contact you. There's just one interview - mostly behavioral questions Asked 5-6 questions normally here back to you right away really easy and quick questions about customer services.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about a time you worked on a team"

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: My interview went really well. They seemed very nice to work with. Good with people. The pay wasn't where I wanted it to be, though. Everyone there were pleasant to be around.
Interview Questions: What do you think would be a good fit for this role?

title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a resume, they decide whether to contact you for an in-person interview. Everyone from the department sits at a table and asks individual questions. The process takes about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What would you contribute to events and marketing in the department?

title: Summer Internship Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I had a well-conducted interview going into the hiring process. As I was preparing to land a summer job, I tried to find out which employers at various institutions would suit my skillset and ideal working environment. The employers at GTRI did a good job of thoroughly inspecting my resume, strong suits, and weaknesses to determine whether I'd be a good fit for their available positions.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term career goals?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Talked to a Hall Director who asked purely behavioral questions. Overall, was a super friendly and chill process. Just practice the STAR method and think of a couple of different scenarios that apply to your leadership experiences, organizing events, and being a part of a community.
Interview Questions: How do you think you will include the diverse residents of your community?

title: Registrar Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I felt as if the interview panel members were Fair, prompt, and reliable in follow up processes. The interview panel also permitted the opportunity to ask questions. I felt comfortable and like my time was valued.
Interview Questions: Provide examples of successful student issue problem solving

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Great process. Had three rounds of interviews. Interviews were informative and asked questions about experience and how I would handle certain situations. The timeline was about 2-3 weeks from interview to offer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Member Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Their interview was pretty casual and was not stressful at all. They just asked me a question about how I deal with other people, how I behave, and how involved I am.
Interview Questions: how you deal with people

title: ASSt Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Rigorous Process, but I would say it is easy to crack for an average person with the required qualification. The questions are very rudimentary however the process is time-consuming and hence rigorous
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years down the line

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough in length. Several steps in the process - almost too many that made me want to back out of the process. Everyone I met was nice and the questions weren’t too hard.
Interview Questions: Describe your advising style to us.

title: Career Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give. This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give. This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give. This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give. This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself today

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick easy very fast the staff are friendly the ask about your previous jobs and what are you expected to get paid basic interview questions that’s all I have to say about ga tech.
Interview Questions: Previous jobs , expected rate

title: Student Assitant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple and they asked basic leadership questions. They were understanding of a lack of experience in the field and were open to learning on the job. There were a lot of people on the call for the interview, which was a little unnerving. It was pretty to the point and a large portion of the interview time was spent explaining the lab the job was with and what my role would be in it.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve an issue with a coworker?

title: Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Email interested professor and they ask for resume. Easy process overall; they then, if interested, scheduled an interview.  The questions asked were slightly difficult because competition is very high in that school. Overall, very worth trying!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a part of our team?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I went to the first round of interviews, which was two hours, and then I got to the second interview and the team and supervisor interviewed me from 8 am to 3 pm. I basically did an interview with all of the staff members working in this department, and they made me believe I to the job, and then I got an email a week after that they took the other candidate.
Interview Questions:
Why Georgia Tech?
Why are you interested in this role? 
 What aspect of the job description are you most excited about?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The screening form had an open-ended essay format, and took me a couple of days to write (I rated the interview process as “difficult”, partly because of this). The interview itself was a remote group interview on MS Teams, and lasted just under an hour. They asked me about myself, my goals, as well as behavioral-style interview questions, such as how I go about data analysis. During the interview, I could tell that some of them were not really paying attention to what I was saying, and weren't taking me seriously. They didn't even follow up with me after the interview. I only learned about the rejection weeks later, after I emailed them, and asked them about the status of my application, because they didn't bother to update it on their website. I'm not even sure if they were serious about hiring, because I just checked the department website, and I don't see any new staff members.
Interview Questions: There was a statistics question: What is R-squared in regression?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and professional, telephonic followed by in person interview.  The in person interview with group about research and development work in the form of  forty five minute presentation. This was followed by Q&A  session, tour of lab and meeting with collaborators
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I had a first round skype interview with faculty from several departments and different colleges. Very standard questions and overall very kind people. I was a bit disappointed to not get the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research.

title: Executive Assistant to the Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very difficult. I had to interview for 5 days straight with each department within the College. There were 3 to 5 people per interview.  I was called by the HR Manager first and interviewed and then had to interview with her again on the fifth day. This could have definitely been a better streamlined process.
Interview Questions: Tell me why do you think that you would be a good fit for our School?

title: Research Engineer II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Excellent! The interview was straightforward and to the point. The job description prepared me for the interview and I got the job offer. I was very impressed with HR at Georgia Tech.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges you have faced in the past?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and one-to-one; I was emailed a link to a BlueJeans meeting. The interviewer gave me a brief list of responsibilities, described the time commitments, and asked if I was okay with all that they had just discussed.
Interview Questions: Are you okay with possibly having to talk through issues with people that are older than you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Good process. Questions were fair. I also had a good time at interview. Some connections were made. The interviewer was very friendly. The total time of this interview was around one hour period.
Interview Questions: Describe your typical day. What is your favorite language?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Structured with a lot of personality questions that required you to use the STAR method. Individuals were friendly and upfront about job expectations and were willing to answer questions about position and training. Interviewed in a virtual panel setting.
Interview Questions: They asked about my ability to work with students and how I managed student expectations.

title: Process Engineer 1 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Initial survey was a 3 question response, and then 4 rounds of interviews 2 with small group and 2 that were one on one's with higher level professors. These interviews and surveys were spread over that last 2-3 months, and then recieved offer letter.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the table, (why should we hire you instead of someone else)

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Semi-formal interview before a panel of colleagues asking questions. Dress appropriately and be prepared to answer some tough questions about your resume or CV and why you are applying. Seemed to go well, staff was friendly,
Interview Questions: Q: What do you think you would contribute to our professional workspace?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: It was a 40min-ish long virtual interview. There were two interviewers. They asked about 10 questions.  The questions were not too picky or difficult to answer. The interviewers were very kind and understandable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. / Why do you want to be an RA? / Tell me about the time you use your creativity.

title: Embedded Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews. The final interview was in person and where you could talk to boss. The process was easy and they were communicative throughout the entire process. I enjoyed talking with them at every round
Interview Questions: What was my  previous experience ?

title: Student Asisstant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Interview was difficult given the scope of the job, but it was fairly standard. I was first asked some questions, then told to do some exercises on a provided computer, and then asked several more questions afterwards.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge you faced and how did you grow from it?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Went to meet with the head of the lab and he asked a few questions. It was very short. It was in the lab. I had to show I could lift heavy things.
Interview Questions: Have you ever changed a tire?

title: Research Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a skype interview with the professor head of the clinical laboratory. I had a few questions about science of viruses and and some question about work ethnic. The questions was simple that can be answer straight forward.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you are working together with a group of people to solve a problem

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process began with a phone screening from the laboratory PI. I was then offered a tour at the facility which was its own interview process discussing current experiments, what I thought about design/methodology/results, and generally gauging my level of excitement.
Interview Questions:
Do you have experience with XYZ measurement technique? How does it work? What are the benefits/ operation range/ detriments of using such a technique.

What do you think of this experimental setup? How do you think this device gives us more/less control over the parameters we are trying to adjust.

title: Systems Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: They reached out via email to schedule an interview; it was scheduled within the week, and the interview took place via Microsoft Teams video chat.  However, I never heard back from them (it looks like the position was defunded maybe).
Interview Questions: They mostly focused on my education & experience; they also asked how comfortable I would be as a system administrator of new BI tools, etc.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Just get prepared and share your thoughts with the professors. Make sure you read several papers and know about the professor's background. They are usually very nice and won't ask questions that are too hard for you,
Interview Questions: Are you capable of applying molucular techniques?

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (New York, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Love this place team mates are great love my boss very easy to work with has a lot to say and very straight forward knows how to help out if you have any questions
Interview Questions: Did you like where you work previously

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview at the office. They asked me questions such as are you proficient in MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook. Have you ever managed such projects?
Interview Questions: Can you talk on the phone and guide people based on their questions?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Good experience. Asked the regular questions. They were very nice. I was interviewed by two people and they were very understanding and friendly. We hit it off like three peas in a pod.
Interview Questions: How has your previous experienced shaped you?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Overall the process was very smooth and the housing directors were very accommodating throughout the process. The interview process lasted about 30 mins and there were about 6 questions. The interview itself had two interviewers asking you questions.
Interview Questions: The interview took about 30 minutes and asked questions in regards to strengths and weaknesses. They also asked what type of diversity and inclusion acitivites you could provide for your floor.

title: Faset Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: They asked a lot of personality type questions, student life involvement, problem solving.  Some of the questions involved what you would do in a hypothetical situation if you encountered a problem in your small group.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a FASET leader

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
It was pretty straight forward the questions were simple,            
                                                                                                                                       
                  The interviewer was nice and relax, she just had a friendly conversation with me. She proceeded in telling me more about the school and the benefits.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 
Tell me why you chose to be a librarian?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a Federal Work Study job at the Institute for Data Engineering & Science by emailing the specified email with my resume, then I completed a simple phone call interview
Interview Questions: background, what I know about the Institute for Data Engineering & Science, what I hope to learn

title: Innovator In Residence Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: the interview process included meeting with two of my superiors to mostly talk about "what if" scenarios that were relevant to the work I ended up doing after landing the job. The answers were pretty intuitive if you read the job description well and have much to do with how to incorporate involvement from the teachers and make sure it's a collaborative effort and not just a time to take over a class.  They also responded well to having some big picture questions about the goals of the program after asking about how the job logistically works.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a teacher was choosing to disengage during your teaching time and treat your lesson as a break?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: conducted a skype interview and discussed work timings as well as job and role responsibilities, then proceeded to go through resume and highlight previous work experiences. Was required to respond to a sample email regarding admissions and email the student back based on the prompt given.
Interview Questions: do you enjoy a fast paced work environment

title: Accounts Payable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Easy.  Took a month to get a call back after applying. After my interview took a week for a call back and an offer.  After offer letter started 3 weeks after signing offer letter.
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths and weakness

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It went well. Phone interview took about one hour. Second round was in-person. It was all day interview with each 45 mins rounds. Overall experience was good. I was offered the role, but declined it due to personal reasons
Interview Questions: Past experience, Coding skills, Problem Solving

title: Brand Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of one round discussing experience and showing my portfolio. Before the interview, I submitted an application online and there were a few other candidates that had the same process before the hiring manager decided who would join the team.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was mostly a formality to make sure I was interested in the position. Very relaxed, learned a lot about the research position and what would be required of me. Got back to me within a week.

Interview questions did not relate to the job in question
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in undergraduate research?

title: Graphic Designer - Digital Signage Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I took the time to create a profile on their very clunky implementation of the Taleo platform, then filled out the specific application for the job post. I received an email saying it was a success.

An hour later, I received an "after careful consideration" rejection email.

It would benefit everyone involved if you take down the post when the position is filled.
Interview Questions: Are you a Georgia Tech Employee?

title: Teaching Assistant, College Or University Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The application involved applying to ta-app.cc.gatech.edu, followed by an interview with a panel involving technical and non-technical questions, along with other administrative notices. Hiring soon followed, with hiring occurring by mid-May.
Interview Questions: Debug an error in sample code.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The process focused primarily on fit and how well my interests matched the interest of the lab. very doable and based off of your real life interests and experiences.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself fit into our lab?

title: ERP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Easy and straightforward. A week long tops. Asked me why I wanted to join and why I should be selected along with my availability and then showed me the office.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Office of Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Passed the phone interview. They invited me to the campus, where I spent an entire day interviewing with a number of 1:1 and panel interview sessions. At the end of the day, they told me that I did really well. I sent thank you notes and followed up with them several weeks later. To this day, I've never received any kind of response. I certainly understand if they decided to go with someone else. But given that I spent the entire day interviewing with these folks, I would have hoped to have gotten some kind of notification.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Georgia Tech? Why do you want to leave your current job? Situational questions.

title: College of Sciences, Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Las Vegas, NV) in Jan 2019

title: Graduate Assistant Interview

title: QA Interview

title: Intern Interview

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Simple, Have knowledge of the research the Professor wants you to work on. Read through the Professors previous research papers and show how aligned your interests is to his work.
Interview Questions: My experience and how could I contribute to his research work

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The team that interviewed me was very clear about expectations for the position and elaborated beyond the job description. They were knowledgeable interviewers. They had great initial communication but I was sort of ghosted. They let me know the process could be lengthy. After five or six weeks I called and was told I was still under consideration. That was the last message or email that was responded to. I reached out an additional three times, once every five or six weeks but have received no response.
Interview Questions: They were interested in my process of research and publishing papers for peer-review.

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a great phone panel interview, then a great in-person panel interview. They said I’d hear some from them in a couple of weeks ... that was five weeks ago. Haven’t heard another word.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work at Georgia Tech.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with a form, recommended by friends and current team members, overall was an okay experience, never had face to face contact before starting, project overall is pretty solid but the low level leadership was not impressive, team members were a very mixed bag
Interview Questions: What is the relationship between leadership and service?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Super simple, expected interview questions. My interviewer was super kind and respectful, so I did not get nervous at all. She emailed me back the following week saying that I got the job. Applying process only took a day or two.
Interview Questions: Past job experiences

title: Corporate Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Met with Dean to evaluate whether there was a good fit between their needs and my experience. The dean was looking for a more administrative role, and less corporate interaction.
Interview Questions: How are you qualified for this pisition

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: One interview asking availability and basic communication skills questions. I was a student assistant so my school schedule was considered. I was interviewed for gadget room, library, multimedia and more. The perks of this job were i got access too staff dining area. Meaning access to microwave and more
Interview Questions: What's your class schedule

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: My employer provides a test sheet to us, all coding questions. Within a limited time, we need to submit code and explanation to him. In the end, he will reply to us who will be hired.
Interview Questions: Build a mask RCNN model to recognize guardrail and light pole.

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in early April, I was contacted for an interview in early May, I interviewed in mid-May, completed an emailed test in late-May, 2nd interview in June, completed background check, reference check and received an auto-generated rejection email in late June.
Interview Questions: What three words would your co-workers use to describe you? Why do you want to work here? What has been your greatest accomplishment? What would you do differently in this position?

title: Information Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty thorough process, 1 phone interview, 1 in-person interview, another phone interview, and several emails back in forth. I needed to provide references. Whole process took about 3 months from submitting application to offer.
Interview Questions:
What technologies are you experienced with? 
How do you handle conflict?
What experience do you have working with students?
Give some examples of handling deadlines or time sensitive projects, and how you handled it?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview, it is mostly behavioral. They ask you a lot of questions about your resume and soft skills. The other half is about what your roles are responsibilities would be in a typical day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a group project you worked on

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Syracuse, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Share your interview experience insights with job seekers so that they can know what to expect from the hiring process. We review and approve every submission against our Community Guidelines before it is published to the site.
Interview Questions: what do you know about our company; why do you choose our company

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview. It was fairly basic. Be familiar with the labs research and make sure to read the papers beyond the abstracts. Don't be surprised if they ask specific questions regarding your thoughts about a paper. After a few basic questions they will just try to get to know you better. So have some interesting talking points about yourself.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in my research?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018

Interview Questions: Whats your favoortie part of social work

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2017

Interview Questions: Basics on the project he was working on.

title: Senior ServiceNow Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Simple telephone and video sessions. No unnecessary questions. Interveiwers were clear on what they wanted and were to the point on knowing my skill set. Not too many rounds but made very good use of the interview time they asked
Interview Questions: Technical questions related to the role.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017

Interview Questions: How would you teach recursion in Python?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about sustainability, architecture, building construction and faciliti management. The interviewer explained the organisational structure and what her team does. I was given an overview of roles and responsibilities they are expecting from me if I get onboard. Then I was told about the work timings as long as the hours are fixed and the compensation.
Interview Questions: What software do you know pertainig to this position?

title: Academic Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Long and met with lots of people in the dept. A LOT of situational questions. "How would you handle..." "Tell us about a time when this happened - what went wrong and what could be done differently next time..." "You mentioned you have experience with this - go into more detail about that..." "Why are you leaving your job?"
Interview Questions: How would you handle a huge mistake with a big client? What would you do differently? What would you say to them to let them know this would never happen again? What steps would you put into place to make sure this never happened again? How would you remedy it right away and for the next time?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Multiple panels following a phone interview. I was interviewed for 3 different positions. Made it to the final 3 each time but wasn't selected. Each time I didn't even receive a non select letter let alone a phone call.  I assumed it was an oversight, but it became a pattern. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult employees

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017

The HR person spent most of the 30 minutes talking about the position, and asked me very few questions. She was unable to answer most of my questions, and said someone from that team would follow up with me. Subsequent queries went unanswered, and I was finally notified 3 months later that I was not selected. I believe the position was recended.
Interview Questions: What tools do you use to manage projects and stay on top of work?

Tell me about yourself?
What traits do you like in a supervisor?

Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016

Interview Questions: N/A

Application online a ndsend your GRE and other scores. Application process takes 2 months.

Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really relaxed and simple. We discussed my background and what I can bring to the table, and how I can grow the department. Then we reviewed my previous work and what I felt my strengths and weaknesses are.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview. The selection process is based on department policy and the amount of graduate students need the position. At the beginning of each semester, advisors will join the school meeting and discuss how many graduate students need the funding support. In addition, graduate students will be required to provide his/her class schedule. After these processes, the graduate students will be informed which class and when he/she will need to come to the class and take the responsibility.
Interview Questions: No interview questions. It depended on school policy and the amount of graduate students need the position.

Interview Descriptions: There was not an interview process. There was a recruitment weekend were we met all of the professors. They took us out to dinner and showed us around the labs. We also got a campus tour.

Interview Questions: Why are you interested in making a pivot from bench work to science policy?

title: Assistant Professor Interview

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Basically they were about my previous research projects and my future plan, my motivations as well. When I was talking about one of my projects, he might be interested and asked me several technical details.
Interview Questions:
What are your research interests?
Why you choose Georgia Tech?

title: Web Developer Interview

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy and the follow-up from the hiring manager was not great.  After a couple of initial phone conversations, I was invited to the center for a panel interview, followed by a 1:1 interview that same day.  After this panel interview, about 2-3 weeks later, I was invited to another panel interview, with 6 entirely different members from the first panel.  There was a brief 1:1 recap after this 2nd panel interview.  After each phase of the interview process, I would go into a black hole with regards to not hearing from the hiring manager, who each of the 1:1 and phone interviews were with.  Although I sent a thank you note after each phase, and to each of the employees represented during the panels, I rarely heard back from anyone.  I even had to email and place several phone calls to the hiring manager, as I was considering other job opportunities in the marketing field, to see if the position was still going to be filled.  I was finally told that it was between myself and one additional candidate, and that another round with the hiring managers boss would be needed.  After waiting several more weeks, I called the hiring manager, only to find out that the position was being altered and the hiring process would need to start over again, including submitting a resume and starting over from the beginning.  How can you go from being one of the top two candidates, to now having to being again?  What a waste of time and poor communication throughout.  Fortunately I found a Marketing Coordinator position with a great company and I am completely happy.  I have been employed here since January, 2014, and I've never looked back.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest flaw? What are you not good at?
