title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It is very informal, I sent my resume to the professor I was interested in working in and we talked about what projects I am interested in and would be working on.
Interview Questions: What type of research are you interested in?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: First you apply online through the Buzzport portal. Usually a committee of new faculty reviews your application, which includes GRE scores, undergrad transcripts, and your research experience as an undergrad. I think there were also some personal essays too. Then it usually takes 1 to 2 months to hear if you are accepted. If you are, of course you would come in August, and at that time you have approximately 1 and a half months to decide on your faculty advisor. However, many students email the professors as soon as they are accepted to get an idea of who they would like to work with beforehand.
Interview Questions: What is your undergrad research?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I brought in my schedule and spoke briefly with the woman who runs the North Avenue Offices. I felt equipped based on the recommendation of a friend that I would be a good fit for the role.
Interview Questions: Can you recall a challenging interaction you have had with a client or customer? How did you respond?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: it is based on the recommendation. you basically need to get recommended. once you are recommended you are almost guaranteed to become an employee. They always hire. so if needed one needs to always look for the coc jobs.
Interview Questions: what do you want to work on?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Three members of the organization sat down with me. It was very informal. They wanted to know what programming experience I had. For the most part, they just were interested in what part of the lab I wanted to work in (computation, experimental, etc.). The whole process lasted 20 minutes at the most.
Interview Questions: Why do you think a manhole cover is round?

title: Senior Vice President of Planning Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were mainly over the phone and also used online tools for candidate diagnostics until the final handful were still standing.  A detailed write-up of prior accomplishments and comprehensive detailed resume along with several letters of recommendation were required also.  The process called for excellent communication skills.  Out of well over 100 feasible applicants, I made it to the final five.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had experience as CFO or Controller of a major institution of higher learning.  That struck me as an odd question since my resume had been closely scrutinized and passed around for months by then and I had asked the recruiter more than once whether my background was acceptable.

title: Facilities Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Questions involving personal situations you have been in like trust, honestly, ethical issues, daily tasks, being on time, working with other people, working with a difficult person, general interview questions to get to know you
Interview Questions: Name a time you juggled multiple tasks at once

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was first interviewed by several senior graduate students of the lab over a conference call. Questions involved were primarily very general in nature, like describe your PhD work, why did you choose this lab, what was your most significant contribution, etc. Once that round was done, I was invited onsite for a face to face interview. This involved a presentation, a detailed question answer session (technical and HR type), a lab tour, and concluding session. Overall, very satisfied with the interview process. Was offered the position after 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Our job involves very applied research with strict deadlines and project deliverables. Have you ever been in such a situation, where you have had to manage a team, collect results, and present it to a sponsor?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: First you have to submit your resume. If they like you based on that resume, then you will be chosen for the interview round. This interview round is one on one which is not too bad at all. They would ask you basic interview questions that mostly involve with make-up situations and your work ethics.  For example, what would you do if you have to work under pressure and you can't meet the due date? Then they like you, you will have to come in for group interview. The questions in group interview are quite similar to individual interview, same concept.
Interview Questions: I would say they kind of caught me off guard when they asked me have you ever dealt with diversity?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process to become a student assistant was very informal. Student assistants are tasked with menial duties like copying, scanning, answering phones and emails, and many other tasks that may pop up anytime. The interview merely consisted of the Associate Director asking me questions about my international experience, office experience, language proficiency, and availability. It was very informal and easy.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.

title: Alumni Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and cover letter online. I heard back about the position via e-mail two days later to schedule and interview for the following week. The Director of Administrative Services went over the position and benefits with me, and was then interviewed by both them and the VP of Alumni Outreach. I was told I would hear back about the position within a week or two and if I hadn't heard anything by then to contact them. I heard back the following week.
Interview Questions: All questions were fairly standard. The interviewers seemed concerned that I would not find the job satisfying or challenging enough.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: What I've got was postdoc job, so I just did phone interview and quick test for my subject area. The job was pretty matching with my background and I was got hired.
Interview Questions: The question was all job related, nothing difficult to answer.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied as a web developer for one of the labs on campus. It was a very informal interview -- we mostly just talked about very high-level concepts and my past experience. There were not any technical questions, just simple stuff like which operating system did I prefer and why, etc. Very easy interview overall.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to accomplish here in your time?

title: Equipment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I posted my resume on Indeed.com.  The prospective employer saw it there and contacted me about an open position.  I can in for a face to face interview with  him and several colleagues.  We had lunch and a tour of the lab facilities.  I met with 4 other engineers.  I will be offered a job, but at a different pay scale
Interview Questions: Why do I want to join the center, for lower money

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I called the hiring officer toward the end of the job interview process. Good timing, it was about to close. I was called in for an interview the next day with the person who supervises the position. After speaking with that person, I was called back to meet the unit director. Very organized and thoughtful interviews.
Interview Questions: One thing they asked is what I know about Georgia Tech and its colleges, programs, etc.

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager found me on the LinkedIn and approached me. Had a very short phone interview. Then they flew me to California for an onsite interview. Had 10 one on one interviews with team members and HRs. Was asked behavior questions such as what is your weakness? What do you know about our company? etc.
Interview Questions: What is the effect of proportional / integral gain in a PID controller

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Look for the call for applicants in late December and then be mindful of the late January deadline. Submit a two-page job letter, CV, and Teaching Portfolio (the teaching portfolio should include qualitative and quantitative data); request for a Skype Interview, 30 minutes, 5 interviewers, questions range from research to teaching.
Interview Questions: How do you see your research connecting to your teaching?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I think the interview is challenging and exciting.
Interview Questions: How do you assign your time between work and life?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Went online and search for the contacting information for the professor I'm interested to work with. Sent him an email with my CV and he said he'll need to review all the potential candidates he got and he'll get back to me later. Then he got back to me directly with offer without any further interview process.
Interview Questions: He didn't ask me anything ....

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Since this was a graduate student position, you just apply online. After acceptance there is a recruitment event in which new potential graduate students get the opportunity to meet with senior grads/postdocs and advisors. Individual meetings are set up for advisors you are interested in. Generally you will meet with the advisor, and separately with their students. Expect to hear back pretty quickly (~1 week).
Interview Questions: What is your background in? Have you done undergraduate research? Which instruments are you familiar with?

title: Student Assistant - MSE Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my resume to the supervisor along with my schedule. She replied with a time to meet for an interview. The interview was pretty basic and the attendees included myself, my intended supervisor, and my supervisor's boss. They were both really friendly. Minimum questions were asked, and it was mostly small talk about school and managing that with work. It was a very easy interview.
Interview Questions: What is your gpa?

title: IT Hardware and Software Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was easy . All they wanted to know was whether I would be able to work for about 6 months and that's about it.
Interview Questions: Your experience with computers?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: a one-on-one interview between the applicant and a hiring manager. The interviewer will ask questions about the applicant's experience and skills, work history, availability, and the qualifications the company is seeking in the optimal candidate for the job
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Very relaxed, not really interview, more like just chatting between friends. Just talk to professor about my interest and plan for my graduate school in the future.
Then talked about course work, my knowledge background, programming experience etc.
Since this is not like job interview in industry, and I am already enrolled in the graduate school.
Interview Questions: What's your interest area

title: Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy, just behavorial questions.
Interview Questions: None.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was not too formal although I found they were very professional. They asked me for reference letters and also they asked me for my previous contributions in science.
Interview Questions: Most of the technical question where addressed to my previous job. I feel comfortable discussing my work so it was not a problem for me.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Going to the pool at campus recreation center; meeting with the head guards there, and one of them will show you around the facilities, and then sitting in the training room and talking with them. Then, talking with the manager. All the questions they asked will be behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How long have you been swimming? Are you a team player?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was good around all technical question on research and biology. Got hired same day. started first as volunteer but started salaried from next month. my PI is awesome. 1st day interview and then they just processed my hiring packet within 15 days.
Interview Questions: If I had special skills for the research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Mainly just behavioral questions
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a standard PhD application, I received a phone call without notification. The professor I wanted to work with (written in SOP) gave me a call. The professor asked me several questions including: why I chose the research lab, what I want to study, what I did during my MS.
Interview Questions: Have you had any programming experience?

title: Head Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basically they review your application, including your grades in 2030 and 2031. Then Dr. Collins will talk to you made sure you are OK. Then there will be a general meeting for new TAs and you can make up your mind then.
Interview Questions: There wasn't any difficult question

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Basic questions and aptitude.
Ability to work in the field and do Data entry
Be available on short notice and flexible with timings.
Ability to follow instructions set out and execute them . take readings and record them accurately
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There is nothing like an interview process, just apply for a PhD. The most important step is the qualifiers exam - both oral and written. Unless one aces the qualifiers exam, one is not formally admitted to a PhD program.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I took a test, diced an onion, talked about current news stories, described desserts and meals I have made.  Interviewer was nice even though I was nervous.  His employees seem to like him.  The kitchen was very clean and roomy.
Interview Questions: I was asked what my specialty is.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very typical. I submitted my application for the graduate school, including online application, recommendation letters, transcript. And then I received an email from my advisor to ask me if I am interested in his lab. I said yes!
Interview Questions: I was not asked a question

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Simple enough interview process. This is especially true for postdocs. It was conducted over teleconference and phone. This can often be a reasonable way to gauge a lab you want to join, but pay special attention to what the existing lab personnel say.
Interview Questions: There was nothing that difficult or unexpected. The salary offer made was unexpectedly low though.

title: Graduate Research Assistant, CEE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applications for fall admission are typically due in late fall of the previous calender year (e.g. fall 2010 admissions close in December 2009, but check the department's webpage, as this can change from year-to-year). Candidates are invited to campus in the spring of the year. These students are accepted, but may not yet have a committed source of funding. Students meet with potential advisors (if they were not sponsored by a particular faculty member) or spend most of their time talking with a particular faculty member. There is typically a social event at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do a PhD?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: It's quite simple for international students. First apply online and send the supplemental materials to the school. While waiting for responses, email professors that you are interested in and communicate with them to impress them. That's it.
Interview Questions: Do you wanna join my research group?

title: Graduate Research Assistant, ChBE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, if accepted, Georgia Tech will invite you to a recruitment weekend to see the campus and meet with students and professors.
Interview Questions: What research area are you interested in?

title: Chemistry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: I networked with a previous professor who was taking sabbatical at Georgia Tech. He put me in touch with the research professor that I interviewed with and now work for. Networking is the best way to get into research at a major university! It also is how 80 percent of job offers are achieved.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was an individual interview why my future advisor. We went through my resume, my research experience, the reasons why I was interested in his research... He also asked me to give a little technical presentation abouthe previous work I have done.... He gave me an answer a couple of days after
Interview Questions: Tell me about one research project you worked on

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Rotational interviews with Professors who are looking for Ph.D and MS researchers
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in pursuing a Ph.D.?

title: Director, Research Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: As a State institution of higher education, Georgia Tech must post openings publicly for at least 30 days, typically on the Institute HR homepage. Everything is submitted electronically. If invited to interview for a director position, there is usually a phone interview first. If the applicant passes to the next stage, he then participates in a face-to-face interview with a group. If he is selected as the finalist, he receives an official offer letter and must respond with an official letter accepting or declining the position. The candidate has the option to call the hiring supervisor to discuss the terms of employment, possible start dates, relocation assistance, benefits, etc. Typically GT will allow some adequate time to relocate and start employment. (Of course, by state law, GT had to perform a criminal background check on me prior to offering me the position, but that is a fairly quick process.)
Interview Questions: How have you demonstrated your ability to work independently at a high level of productivity and initiative?

title: Production Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by phone Manager set up interview. 1st interview group - situational questions. 2nd interview group department staff questioned about likes and dislikes. Entire department was very laid back and nice
Interview Questions: What are you going to do if you get bored?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Met with the professor and his assistant
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you felt challenged in the workplace?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process, phone conversation that lead to a 1 on 1 chat. Lasted about 30 minutes. Asked questions about my background, why I was interested, what my previous experience was, and my potential schedule conflicts. Great job, and great people. Georgia Tech is a wonderful community.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and submitted alll the materials they asked for, including TOEFL, GRE, transcripts, resume, personal statement and also recommendation letters. After they went through the first background check, the professors who were interested in your background would contact you and asked you a few questions. If he/she is satisfied, you would get an offer from them.
Interview Questions: Here it requires solid mathematical background, are you confident in yours?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the professor I was interested in working with by email. Simultaneously I submitted the grad school application to the Prof's department, and specified his name as first choice. A while later (1-2 months) they contacted me to schedule an interview. The interview I met with 4 or 5 profs including my first choice. There were 10-15 other admitted prospective students. It was a pleasant process. My advisor did most of the talking during our meeting time. This was my first interview really so I was not particularly savvy about the questions I asked.
Interview Questions: (Incredulously) You've only taken X number of classes in your field of interest??

title: Peer Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: After applying there is two interviews.  The first is a group interview where they ask you to design activities as a team.  Here they are really looking at how you work with others.  Everyone tries to be a leader, but what really impresses people is letting others lead while still contributing to the team.  The second interview is a traditional interview with a Hall Director and a current Peer Leader.  Here they go into detail about your leadership experiences and ask what you would do in certain situations on the job
Interview Questions: They really like to know if you have first aid experience and will ask questions about it

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Had telephone interview with 2 senior people. Was then offered a trip down to interview in person. Spent the day interviewing with different people, including manager.  1 week later was told on offer would be coming.
Interview Questions: Describe past research and what you want to research in the future.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Had to communicate with individual professors separately, and see if I am a good fit for their research lab, and vice versa. Usually through emails. In many cases, there is no reply or a short reply, and the professors have very busy schedules.
Interview Questions: In my case, getting into the lab wasn't difficult. Mostly it's performing after I got in, and whether the professor thinks he should fund me or not based on my performance after a semester or two. It seems almost contractual every semester. I do not know for sure whether I will be kept as GRA, or whether I will be paid a different amount, each semester.

title: Senior Systems Support Engineer Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: most of the time the post the information on the web
Interview Questions: It is not difficult at all

title: Roll Call Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application the Roll Call Manager will call you; you must be an active student to be employed in the call center.  Once the phone interview is open, the first 3 days are considered training and then you go live.
Interview Questions: In the beginning learning to take the 'canned speech' and make it your own, or per the caller's intent of asking questions or receiving accurate information.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: An email was sent to all students. I attached my resume along with the email. After about 20 days I got an interview offer with a particular date and time. I prepared real hard on the semiconductor devices and also made a presentation on the current research topics of the prof. he was really impressed by this presentation.
Interview Questions: How would you see yourself in 2 years time?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions:
# Describe a situation in which you were able to use persuasion to successfully convince someone to see things your way.

# Describe a time when you were faced with a stressful situation that demonstrated your coping skills.

# Give me a specific example of a time when you used good judgment and logic in solving a problem.

# Give me an example of a time when you set a goal and were able to meet or achieve it.

# Tell me about a time when you had to use your presentation skills to influence someone's opinion.
Interview Questions: Give me a specific example of a time when you used good judgment and logic in solving a problem

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: One phone screen and one technical interview
Interview Questions: Why Analog design as your specialization?

title: Seasonal Reader (Office of Undergraduate Admission) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Great communication and professionalism. Zoom interview was thorough but relaxing and interviewers were open to any questions. Follow up email questions were answered promptly. Also, provided a schedule when offers would be sent and adhered to that, which I always appreciate.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Toured research lab and spoke to current students about their projects and work. I also met with the professor who leads the lab. I was impressed with the facilities they have.
Interview Questions: What research subjects interest me?

title: HR- Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The interview for an HR job was very professional and everyone was so nice. I hope this reflects the way HR conducts themselves in general. They are also using a really cool online video interview system called HireVue that was really convenient.
Interview Questions: They asked traditional questions about strengths and weaknesses, but with a focus on innovation and technology.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Organized and helpful, kept it to get point. Stayed in contact to keep me updated and aware. All people involved were kind and respectful. There was no ambiguity in the entire interview process.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview questions and overall a smooth interview process. I was invited to a lab setting and interviewed with current lab mates and then the professor/ researcher. I was asked different behavioral questions and technical questions regarding the skills they desired.
Interview Questions: What is your professional strength?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Pretty smooth interview. Company is a father son owned. They have several companies in surrounding cities. They offer relocation and remote offices. Waiting to hear back to see if I get the job. Tasks are really simple just answering phone.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to relocate

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: IT was an online interview with about 10 questions. I had to introduce my research experiences and my published journal papers. Research interests and plans are also asked. After the interview, I just waited. It takes about 1~2 week to receive the offer.
Interview Questions: Introduce Yourself. Introduce your research experience. What research do you want to proceed with in the future?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple and casual. The manager really cared about how I would fit in as well as my aptitude for the position and personality traits. At the time of hire, many other candidates were considered. I had to take an assessment / test.
Interview Questions: The cared more about how I would fit with the team.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: First Screening was on the basis of CV, and then a short casual interview on past experiences and why I would be interested in working on the project at hand
Interview Questions: Describe what you did in (one particular) past project

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Four-stage process. One pre-screen with hiring manager, one panel interview with prepared 5-min presentation on a question they posed, one final interview with hiring manager and hiring manager's manager, and one in-person lunch (not a formal interview, but who are we kidding?)
Interview Questions: Advanced Question: Measuring Project Success: Provide an example of a prior experience where you developed and implemented "novel" accountability metrics (KPIs) to measure a project's performance, success, and/or impacts. What was the process used to determine what was to be measured and how was the implementation process introduced? Follow-Up 1: What accountability tactics were put in place to identify any needed adjustments in the process once launched? Follow-Up 2: How did you contribute to successfully communicating the metrics/results to the project sponsor?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: An online application was due in early December. This was followed by a Zoom interview in early January. In person visit in March. Decisions were expected by mid April with decision coming out just after the in person interview
Interview Questions: What is your motivation for grad school?

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Not easy I had to show my understanding of how to link and connect with different people . It was hard at first to get to understand what is needed of me.
Interview Questions: What is the best way for you to maintain a contact?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I was already working for credits with Gatech. I requested to work during the summer and get paid. Based on the skills I had and recommendations, I got the interview.

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions:
Simple interview about previous experience with class material and grade in class. 

Very nice staff involved, but Human Resources is a bit slow for first hire. I did not get paid until second half of the semester
Interview Questions: What are some of your previous experience

title: Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2022

title: Graduate Student Interview

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: A zoom interview with the lab manager and phd students assisting on the research. The interview lasted 30 minutes in length. It was very short and I was told I would hear back. I never heard from the lab manager again.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process. Everyone is very nice and will help you throughout the process. It is normally only one interview and only 15-20 minutes long. I would highly recommend interviewing for a position here.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: One round- pretty short. It was a very short interview with the person asking my skills and previous experience, took a week to get back to me. Got the offer!
Interview Questions: What year do you graduate?

title: Office Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Really positive and a loving environment, very easy to talk to and easy to answer questions, really enjoyed being able to interview and learn more about the process and duties of being an office assistant
Interview Questions: What do you want from being an office assistant?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Interview was virtual, I presented my self introduction, went into a review of job requirements, the interview was really simple and straightforward.  Interview went over job duties. Discussed work availabilities.
Interview Questions: Work Schedule, Previous work experience

title: Graduate Student Interview

Interview Questions: Tell me about your experiments and how you if you have had to troubleshoot a protocol.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Not too hard. Interview with university professor. Asked about my background and also some technical questions for the subject I was applying. Got an offer after some more personality interviews.

title: Customer Service Supervisor Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview was Calvin and Richard. They had no clue about call center and were uninterested in interviewing me both were on the phone when doing the interview with me. They were not engaged at all.

title: Behavioral Health Professional Interview

Interview Descriptions: Meet with allied health professionals, the mental health professional, Director. Typical questions ask of licensed doctors. to include questions around ethics boundaries, mandated reporting and resources.  Understanding of DSM-5, diagnosis, assessment ...........
Interview Questions: Inquired about off-hours availability for crisis

title: Mechanical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The process was Very upfront, professional and easy to complete. The whole process was very inviting however I decided not to relocate due to personal family needs. Would apply again should my career path direct me to Ga again.

title: Member Service Assistant Interview

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: My interview went really well. They seemed very nice to work with. Good with people. The pay wasn't where I wanted it to be, though. Everyone there were pleasant to be around.
Interview Questions: What do you think would be a good fit for this role?

title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a resume, they decide whether to contact you for an in-person interview. Everyone from the department sits at a table and asks individual questions. The process takes about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What would you contribute to events and marketing in the department?

title: Summer Internship Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I had a well-conducted interview going into the hiring process. As I was preparing to land a summer job, I tried to find out which employers at various institutions would suit my skillset and ideal working environment. The employers at GTRI did a good job of thoroughly inspecting my resume, strong suits, and weaknesses to determine whether I'd be a good fit for their available positions.

title: Resident Advisor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Talked to a Hall Director who asked purely behavioral questions. Overall, was a super friendly and chill process. Just practice the STAR method and think of a couple of different scenarios that apply to your leadership experiences, organizing events, and being a part of a community.
Interview Questions: How do you think you will include the diverse residents of your community?

title: Registrar Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I felt as if the interview panel members were Fair, prompt, and reliable in follow up processes. The interview panel also permitted the opportunity to ask questions. I felt comfortable and like my time was valued.
Interview Questions: Provide examples of successful student issue problem solving

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Great process. Had three rounds of interviews. Interviews were informative and asked questions about experience and how I would handle certain situations. The timeline was about 2-3 weeks from interview to offer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Member Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Their interview was pretty casual and was not stressful at all. They just asked me a question about how I deal with other people, how I behave, and how involved I am.
Interview Questions: how you deal with people

title: ASSt Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Rigorous Process, but I would say it is easy to crack for an average person with the required qualification. The questions are very rudimentary however the process is time-consuming and hence rigorous
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years down the line

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough in length. Several steps in the process - almost too many that made me want to back out of the process. Everyone I met was nice and the questions weren’t too hard.
Interview Questions: Describe your advising style to us.

title: Career Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give. This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give. This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give. This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give. This is ridiculous. I just want to view salary information. I do not have a review to give.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself today

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick easy very fast the staff are friendly the ask about your previous jobs and what are you expected to get paid basic interview questions that’s all I have to say about ga tech.
Interview Questions: Previous jobs , expected rate

title: Student Assitant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple and they asked basic leadership questions. They were understanding of a lack of experience in the field and were open to learning on the job. There were a lot of people on the call for the interview, which was a little unnerving. It was pretty to the point and a large portion of the interview time was spent explaining the lab the job was with and what my role would be in it.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve an issue with a coworker?

title: Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Email interested professor and they ask for resume. Easy process overall; they then, if interested, scheduled an interview.  The questions asked were slightly difficult because competition is very high in that school. Overall, very worth trying!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a part of our team?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I went to the first round of interviews, which was two hours, and then I got to the second interview and the team and supervisor interviewed me from 8 am to 3 pm. I basically did an interview with all of the staff members working in this department, and they made me believe I to the job, and then I got an email a week after that they took the other candidate.
Interview Questions:
Why Georgia Tech?
Why are you interested in this role? 
 What aspect of the job description are you most excited about?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The screening form had an open-ended essay format, and took me a couple of days to write (I rated the interview process as “difficult”, partly because of this). The interview itself was a remote group interview on MS Teams, and lasted just under an hour. They asked me about myself, my goals, as well as behavioral-style interview questions, such as how I go about data analysis. During the interview, I could tell that some of them were not really paying attention to what I was saying, and weren't taking me seriously. They didn't even follow up with me after the interview. I only learned about the rejection weeks later, after I emailed them, and asked them about the status of my application, because they didn't bother to update it on their website. I'm not even sure if they were serious about hiring, because I just checked the department website, and I don't see any new staff members.
Interview Questions: There was a statistics question: What is R-squared in regression?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and professional, telephonic followed by in person interview.  The in person interview with group about research and development work in the form of  forty five minute presentation. This was followed by Q&A  session, tour of lab and meeting with collaborators
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I had a first round skype interview with faculty from several departments and different colleges. Very standard questions and overall very kind people. I was a bit disappointed to not get the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research.

title: Executive Assistant to the Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very difficult. I had to interview for 5 days straight with each department within the College. There were 3 to 5 people per interview.  I was called by the HR Manager first and interviewed and then had to interview with her again on the fifth day. This could have definitely been a better streamlined process.
Interview Questions: Tell me why do you think that you would be a good fit for our School?

title: Research Engineer II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Excellent! The interview was straightforward and to the point. The job description prepared me for the interview and I got the job offer. I was very impressed with HR at Georgia Tech.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges you have faced in the past?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Are you okay with possibly having to talk through issues with people that are older than you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Good process. Questions were fair. I also had a good time at interview. Some connections were made. The interviewer was very friendly. The total time of this interview was around one hour period.
Interview Questions: Describe your typical day. What is your favorite language?

Interview Questions: They asked about my ability to work with students and how I managed student expectations.

title: Process Engineer 1 Interview

Interview Questions: What do you bring to the table, (why should we hire you instead of someone else)

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Semi-formal interview before a panel of colleagues asking questions. Dress appropriately and be prepared to answer some tough questions about your resume or CV and why you are applying. Seemed to go well, staff was friendly,
Interview Questions: Q: What do you think you would contribute to our professional workspace?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: It was a 40min-ish long virtual interview. There were two interviewers. They asked about 10 questions.  The questions were not too picky or difficult to answer. The interviewers were very kind and understandable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. / Why do you want to be an RA? / Tell me about the time you use your creativity.

title: Embedded Systems Engineer Interview

Interview Questions: What was my  previous experience ?

title: Student Asisstant Interview

title: Lab Technician Interview

Interview Questions:
Do you have experience with XYZ measurement technique? How does it work? What are the benefits/ operation range/ detriments of using such a technique.

What do you think of this experimental setup? How do you think this device gives us more/less control over the parameters we are trying to adjust.

title: Systems Architect Interview

Interview Questions: They mostly focused on my education & experience; they also asked how comfortable I would be as a system administrator of new BI tools, etc.

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Just get prepared and share your thoughts with the professors. Make sure you read several papers and know about the professor's background. They are usually very nice and won't ask questions that are too hard for you,

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (New York, NY) in Feb 2020

It was pretty straight forward the questions were simple,

Tell me about yourself?

They also responded well to having some big picture questions about the goals of the program after asking about how the job logistically works.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a teacher was choosing to disengage during your teaching time and treat your lesson as a break?

title: Student Assistant Interview

title: Accounts Payable Specialist Interview

Interview questions did not relate to the job in question

An hour later, I received an "after careful consideration" rejection email.

It would benefit everyone involved if you take down the post when the position is filled.

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Office of Information Technology Interview

At the end of the day, they told me that I did really well. I sent thank you notes and followed up with them several weeks later. To this day, I've never received any kind of response. I certainly understand if they decided to go with someone else. But given that I spent the entire day interviewing with these folks, I would have hoped to have gotten some kind of notification.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Georgia Tech? Why do you want to leave your current job? Situational questions.

title: College of Sciences, Student Assistant Interview

 Pretty short and friendly, took about 15 minutes.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview

title: QA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
