title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Super simple, expected interview questions. My interviewer was super kind and respectful, so I did not get nervous at all. She emailed me back the following week saying that I got the job. Applying process only took a day or two.
Interview Questions: Past job experiences

title: Corporate Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Met with Dean to evaluate whether there was a good fit between their needs and my experience. The dean was looking for a more administrative role, and less corporate interaction.
Interview Questions: How are you qualified for this pisition

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: One interview asking availability and basic communication skills questions. I was a student assistant so my school schedule was considered. I was interviewed for gadget room, library, multimedia and more. The perks of this job were i got access too staff dining area. Meaning access to microwave and more
Interview Questions: What's your class schedule

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: My employer provides a test sheet to us, all coding questions. Within a limited time, we need to submit code and explanation to him. In the end, he will reply to us who will be hired.
Interview Questions: Build a mask RCNN model to recognize guardrail and light pole.

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in early April, I was contacted for an interview in early May, I interviewed in mid-May, completed an emailed test in late-May, 2nd interview in June, completed background check, reference check and received an auto-generated rejection email in late June.
Interview Questions: What three words would your co-workers use to describe you? Why do you want to work here? What has been your greatest accomplishment? What would you do differently in this position?

title: Information Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty thorough process, 1 phone interview, 1 in-person interview, another phone interview, and several emails back in forth. I needed to provide references. Whole process took about 3 months from submitting application to offer.
Interview Questions:
What technologies are you experienced with? 
How do you handle conflict?
What experience do you have working with students?
Give some examples of handling deadlines or time sensitive projects, and how you handled it?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview, it is mostly behavioral. They ask you a lot of questions about your resume and soft skills. The other half is about what your roles are responsibilities would be in a typical day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a group project you worked on

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Syracuse, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Share your interview experience insights with job seekers so that they can know what to expect from the hiring process. We review and approve every submission against our Community Guidelines before it is published to the site.
Interview Questions: what do you know about our company; why do you choose our company

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview. It was fairly basic. Be familiar with the labs research and make sure to read the papers beyond the abstracts. Don't be surprised if they ask specific questions regarding your thoughts about a paper. After a few basic questions they will just try to get to know you better. So have some interesting talking points about yourself.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in my research?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Came into office for face to face interview the manager was nice and told me about the benefits. I asked what it was liek to work there he siad it was cool
Interview Questions: Whats your favoortie part of social work

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple, mailed the professor . He asked for the interest and gave the offer. He described the project and the current status and explained what my work would be for the project. He described the time dedication per week on the project.
Interview Questions: Basics on the project he was working on.

title: Senior ServiceNow Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Simple telephone and video sessions. No unnecessary questions. Interveiwers were clear on what they wanted and were to the point on knowing my skill set. Not too many rounds but made very good use of the interview time they asked
Interview Questions: Technical questions related to the role.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: A group of teaching assistants were in the room and I was asked to teach about recursion and pretend that the TAs were students who had never taken the class before
Interview Questions: How would you teach recursion in Python?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about sustainability, architecture, building construction and faciliti management. The interviewer explained the organisational structure and what her team does. I was given an overview of roles and responsibilities they are expecting from me if I get onboard. Then I was told about the work timings as long as the hours are fixed and the compensation.
Interview Questions: What software do you know pertainig to this position?

title: Academic Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Long and met with lots of people in the dept. A LOT of situational questions. "How would you handle..." "Tell us about a time when this happened - what went wrong and what could be done differently next time..." "You mentioned you have experience with this - go into more detail about that..." "Why are you leaving your job?"
Interview Questions: How would you handle a huge mistake with a big client? What would you do differently? What would you say to them to let them know this would never happen again? What steps would you put into place to make sure this never happened again? How would you remedy it right away and for the next time?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Multiple panels following a phone interview. I was interviewed for 3 different positions. Made it to the final 3 each time but wasn't selected. Each time I didn't even receive a non select letter let alone a phone call.  I assumed it was an oversight, but it became a pattern. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult employees

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with a committee of mid managers that were engaged with this position day to day. Was called for a 1:1 interview with the same group of staff members. After that interview I was offered the position around 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experiences relenvant to this position.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very pleasant. The phone interview went well and the people were very polite.  Everything was very professional. I feel that the interviewers aptly represented their establishment and had a good energy about them.
Interview Questions: What kind of employer do you work best with?

title: Quality Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I apply online through a job search called Handshake provided from my University. I look through the position and click to apply.  I revived a email about wanted to interview me through phone.
Interview Questions: The Questions they asked me was how was this position related to my interest.  Also another was what were my hobbies and what did I like from my university.  They asked what did I like about my career.

title: Graduate Research Assistant, ME Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process wasn't an interview to get into the school, it was an application of your past records and test scores plus an essay or two. There was interviews with the various professors that you might work with. Those for me were pretty laid back. They mostly asked what type of things I had worked on previously, what my motivations for going to graduate school were, and what my research interests were. I don't remember any technical questions. I recommend during the advisor search to schedule your interviews early.
Interview Questions: What gets you up in the morning?

title: Swim Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online, came in for one round of interviews, was asked about my experience. They were looking for answers regarding your experience previously, and they hired you on the spot. You will have to do a three hour class to prepare for swim lessons the way they want it to be taught.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with teaching swimming?

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Talked to professor, got recommended to administration. Got an offer a few weeks later. Went to the human resources building to fill out appropriate paperwork and I was ready to go.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1st round: 30 minute technical phone interview, mostly about internet networking
Lots of questions are asked, many of which the answers can be found by studying the wreck techs web site. 
2nd round: In person behavioral interview with the boss and another lead assistant
Interview Questions: The difference between ipv4 and ipv6 addressing

title: Intern Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the marketing director about the job. We emailed back and forth to set a time for a phone interview. After that, I met her at her office to do an in-person interview and learn more about the company.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to use Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitting application documents - and after selection - interviewing with Lab PI. Interview is mostly a Skype interview. If you're asked for an interview, means you get it - and it is just to discuss specifics of the job.
Interview Questions: What kind of projects would you like to work on?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted over Skype, because I was out of town at the time. The questions were related to my potential role and how my past experiences would make me a good leaderl
Interview Questions: How have you shown leadership?

title: HCM Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Round table panel discussion with managers and employees.  Aprrox.  5 individuals.  They gave a break down of the organizational structure, what their expectations were for this new candidate,  benefits they provide.  At the second interview, I was given a quick quiz/worksheet to see how knowledgeable I was on the area of work.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for GT?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview for this job. The process of applying this job was to submit your application online (one recommendation letter from your previous CHBE professor was required). After you submit your application, they will assign some course that you are willing to do.
Interview Questions: What kind of course you want to do?

title: Academic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: You should be prepared to interview at least two- three times. The first interview is a phone interview is normally with directors of department and/or HR. This interview is very general and use to get to know about you and your skills. Next, is your in-person panel interview. These are normally with 3-4 people, if not a whole department. They last about 1.5-2 hours.
Interview Questions: Can you describe something challenging you encounter in your position and how did you overcome it?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied to GaTech as for grad student position. I got an email from a faculty member after that, and I was interviewed by the faculty member for admission. I got my offer when the admission decisions were out.
Interview Questions:
Mostly related to my previous research: what I did, how I did it, whether I understood the methodologies, among other questions.

In additions, I was also asked how I was a fit with the professor. I did my background study before applying to the school. Hence, I know how I would address the question.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: Met with lab post doc. Simply sat down and worked through resume. Asking for examples along the way. I was asked to describe various techniques and softwares stated in my resume. Matlab in particular. Asked about being a team leader.
Interview Questions: Q: Give me an example of a problem you solved using xx method you learned

title: Postal Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed and talked with the supervisor. It was pretty simple after she asked my available times, I was introduced the workspace and daily phases of the postal office at Georgia Tech Student Center
Interview Questions: How many classes will you be taking?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: - Brief sit in with the people involved, talk about the research and responsibilities, as well as time commitment (was part time). The position varies for the professor and school you work with within Georgia Tech, some may be much harder than others. I was lucky as they needed a lot of new members coming into the lab.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our projects?

title: Kitchen Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I was called to do a phone interview.I was asked very easy questions about my work history and my hobbies. They wanted to make sure that I was a team player as I would be working in a large group.
Interview Questions: What experience in kitchens do you have?

title: Technical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was great. Everyone was down to earth and asked good situational questions. They made me feel comfortable during the process. Although the atmosphere was that of a formal panel style interview, it was very light as everyone spoke of there own experiences that help you feel connected to those in the room.
Interview Questions: Describe how you handled a situation that required you to help a non technical person with a technical issue?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1. General Application or contact specific professors
2. phone or in person interview 
3. if positive, the following might happen:
- directly hire as GRA
- will be admitted to work for credit for at least one semester
Interview Questions: About past experience and research interests.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: No interview. Just ask the professor and if there is availability you will get in. Just make sure you have good grades and ask well in advance. I have nothing more to add but will keep typing to reach the min words required to submit...
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions:
This is not an normal interview for a job offer. This is just an interview for graudate scholl application.
 I submitted all materials online. After two month, the acadmic office of ECE department of Gatech decieded to accept me. Then, after I came here, I sent a professor an email, tried to join his lab for research. After talking with him, him accepted me, gladely.
Interview Questions: Questions about my research background

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: After applying for one position, I was asked to apply for another position because I was "a good fit." An initial phone screen was scheduled for 3 weeks later. The person conducting the phone screen was an HR person, someone not normally assigned to the team this position would support. The HR person spent most of the 30 minutes talking about the position, and asked me very few questions. She was unable to answer most of my questions, and said someone from that team would follow up with me. Subsequent queries went unanswered, and I was finally notified 3 months later that I was not selected. I believe the position was recended.
Interview Questions: What tools do you use to manage projects and stay on top of work?

title: Biomedical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager contacted me via LinkedIn and asked me to interview for the open position. Had a quick phone interview and then was scheduled for a face-to-face shortly after. The face-to-face lasted about 60 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why Georgia tech?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed through skype and it was friendly conversation about how the position will be beneficial for me and how I can be beneficial for the PI.  Generally a pleasant interview.
Interview Questions: Is $45000 a year OK for you?

title: Student Accounts Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online & received a call 3 weeks later to set up a phone interview. 20 min phone interview with director of student accounts ended with invitation for face to face interview. F2f a few days later with assistant director & director. Very laid back and casual environment. Never heard back regarding a decision.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What traits do you like in a supervisor?
Why should we hire you? 
What BANNER screens have you used?
Describe your typical work day.

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions:
Straightforward process. Send CV with statement of research to the Prof along with publications sample. Face Skype/physical interview, discuss what you the research.

Wait for few weeks for the final decision.
Interview Questions: What you have done, what are your plan, and how do you meet the criteria and skills related to the project.

title: IT Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and attended a brief, in person interview. There was not any kind of technical skill testing during initial interview, but there may have been a skills test during a future stage of the interview..
Interview Questions: Can you see yourself working here?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Informal chat with your prospective adviser as well as the potential to speak to other professors in your prospective department. I received an offer within a week of the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very chill, easy going, nice, I definitely liked the experience, the people were very professional and they explained all the job process and even trained me the day i got there.
Interview Questions: About yourself, your background, what your major is

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just emailed the professors I was interested in working for, the ones who were looking for help emailed me back. I then set up a meeting with the ones I was interested in most and ended up getting offered the job at the very laid back interview, which was more like a description of their work and getting to know each other.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here?

title: Sale Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: irst screening interview was coffee offsite with two members of the practice group. They provided an overview of the practice and answered questions in a casual atmosphere. "Call back" interview was several weeks later, for half day. There were four 20-minute interviews with managers or above--make sure to prepare several questions to ask during this process. Following the four interviews was lunch nearby with two associates. Much more casual, but
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Application online a ndsend your GRE and other scores. Application process takes 2 months.
We have to submit everything online and the admits are sent some 3 months later. The I20 are sent somewhere in May. The college starts in August
Interview Questions: GRE TOEFL and under-graduate scores

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met multiple advisors and discussed my background and research interests. The advisor discussed their work and expertise as well as funded positions. Additional discussion included future career plans and whether the academia or industry route was of interest.
Interview Questions: What is your relevant work experience? What are your research interests?

title: Marketing and Social Media Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really relaxed and simple. We discussed my background and what I can bring to the table, and how I can grow the department. Then we reviewed my previous work and what I felt my strengths and weaknesses are.
Interview Questions: How do you think you can grow our department?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview. The selection process is based on department policy and the amount of graduate students need the position. At the beginning of each semester, advisors will join the school meeting and discuss how many graduate students need the funding support. In addition, graduate students will be required to provide his/her class schedule. After these processes, the graduate students will be informed which class and when he/she will need to come to the class and take the responsibility.
Interview Questions: No interview questions. It depended on school policy and the amount of graduate students need the position.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: There was not an interview process. There was a recruitment weekend were we met all of the professors. They took us out to dinner and showed us around the labs. We also got a campus tour.
Interview Questions: There were no interview questions. We did meet with professors to hear about their research.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I received a response for the job in a week after applying. I had the opportunity to meet the Director in person briefly before my interview and had a pleasant conversation. 
The interview was an hour long. It was a very relaxed interview and the person conducting the interview was conversational. I was asked about my view on the state of the chemistry departments and what I feel is impacting the growth of the field from a scientific and personnel perspective.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in making a pivot from bench work to science policy?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: It was great with the late leader and chairperson of the department. He was very courteous, He knew what the department wanted and was a great motivator. But alas after he died the department lost all.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply to Georgia Tech?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (New York, NY) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very nice and very professional. Only my future advisor attended the interview. In the beginning, I gave a brief self-introduction. Then he asked questions. Basically they were about my previous research projects and my future plan, my motivations as well. When I was talking about one of my projects, he might be interested and asked me several technical details.
Interview Questions:
What are your research interests?
Why you choose Georgia Tech?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy. I was asked simple HR questions. I was really interested in what they were doing. I was lead in designing and implementing a whole web page
Interview Questions: Do you know Programming?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The interview is really just an informal talk with the administrator of the graduate students of your department. If you first talk to your advisor (who is the one that suggests a TA for you in case he/she cannot provide funding for your research). Then you go to the academic advisor to inquiry about TA positions available in the department. You need to be a little pushy to make sure you have all your expenses covered
Interview Questions: Basic questions on your strengths (which classes you should/could TA for) and any previous experience

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I had a one on one interview with the academic adviser in the department to check and test my technical knowledge, skills and prior experience related to the field. I was also introduced to the head of department but no interview was taken at that level.
Interview Questions: What are the relevant projects you have done?

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very interesting. I went in for 3 interviews. The first was easy. The second was a little difficult. The third wasn't even an interview. They were lovely and offered me coffee and food. The only thing I had a problem with was how long it took for Ga Tech to send me an offer letter.
Interview Questions: Q: What questions do you expect me to ask you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come in with my resume and knowledge of my weekly schedule.  The interview was very informal.  I got the interview through a friend who said if the boss is meeting with me, then I pretty much had the job.  The location was in my boss' office.  She described her department, her duties, and the duties of the job I was interviewing for.  Then after that she introduced her two conditions for employment, which were if I had any problems arriving to work on time and when I was available to work.
Interview Questions: What times are you available?

title: Student Center Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was referee by a friend, another student, and talked over email to his manager. I then had an in person interview where general questions were asked.

I was asked to interview again for the next term in November.
Interview Questions: you have finished your work For the day and a manager is nowhere to be found.

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: First, there's a phone screening.  If they like you, you will be invited to an in person interview (short notice).  The interview is  with pretty much the entire team of DBAs  as well as the application, OS, & network team
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just went and talked to a research professor. He asked me to come in the next day. He had a group of students there who were interested in hiring RA's and they each described the various projects that they were working on. Just had to approach a student, tell him/her what you're interested in accomplishing and wait to hear back
Interview Questions: Why do you want to take this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I did online application so there was no personal interview. They send me a confirmation email and congratulate me on obtaining the position. Of course you have to be prepared very well before you apply to this position. For example, you need to have a good GPA and language proof and so on.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel, asked about 15 question and 8 people were on the panel from different areas of the departments. After the panel interview I interviewed with the director, 1 on 1.
Interview Questions: Scenarios

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Round table interview.   Three people at once. Hiring manager,  HR Advisor and HR rep. Sat at a conference table and each asked a variety of question .
Interview Questions: Years of experience.? How do you handle pressure. How manage time.

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted a little more than a month after applying online. The initial telephone interview was 30 min. There were 3 people on the panel. Was contacted a week later for a face to face interview, but declined because the salary was lower than I expected. Otherwise, the interviewers were very friendly and informative. Would recommend to apply.
Interview Questions:
Describe yourself?
Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple meeting with the advisor and they provided a short tour of their lab. Also met with other graduate students that were currently working in the lab. Overall it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Why I am interested in working in their lab.

title: Technical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I first received a 40 minute conversation on the job description. It was a lot of blabbering, when we got towards the end I asked if I could get a more descriptive description, instead she then invited me in for an interview. Boy did it go bad. Not only was the job description irrelevant, the questions were difficult and ego-driven. For a technical support position at a university this was unnecessary. I felt incompetent like my 6 years of experience didn't matter.

1) What is the different between STP and RSTP?
2) Can you explain Cam Stack Overflow?

Plus it was a panel interview on top of that (5 or 6 interviewers). They didn't really ask any technical questions but instead opted for more behavioral scenarios. title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy and the follow-up from the hiring manager was not great.  After a couple of initial phone conversations, I was invited to the center for a panel interview, followed by a 1:1 interview that same day.  After this panel interview, about 2-3 weeks later, I was invited to another panel interview, with 6 entirely different members from the first panel.  There was a brief 1:1 recap after this 2nd panel interview.  After each phase of the interview process, I would go into a black hole with regards to not hearing from the hiring manager, who each of the 1:1 and phone interviews were with.  Although I sent a thank you note after each phase, and to each of the employees represented during the panels, I rarely heard back from anyone.  I even had to email and place several phone calls to the hiring manager, as I was considering other job opportunities in the marketing field, to see if the position was still going to be filled.  I was finally told that it was between myself and one additional candidate, and that another round with the hiring managers boss would be needed.  After waiting several more weeks, I called the hiring manager, only to find out that the position was being altered and the hiring process would need to start over again, including submitting a resume and starting over from the beginning.  How can you go from being one of the top two candidates, to now having to being again?  What a waste of time and poor communication throughout.  Fortunately I found a Marketing Coordinator position with a great company and I am completely happy.  I have been employed here since January, 2014, and I've never looked back.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest flaw? What are you not good at?

Interview Descriptions: The interview and hiring process was very minimal.  I applied online and received a call within a week. I was told to come in for a panel interview. After the panel interview I had an interview with the chief and deputy chief of police.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: First you have to submit your resume. If they like you based on that resume, then you will be chosen for the interview round. This interview round is one on one which is not too bad at all. They would ask you basic interview questions that mostly involve with make-up situations and your work ethics.  For example, what would you do if you have to work under pressure and you can't meet the due date? Then they like you, you will have to come in for group interview. The questions in group interview are quite similar to individual interview, same concept.
Interview Questions: I would say they kind of caught me off guard when they asked me have you ever dealt with diversity?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process to become a student assistant was very informal. Student assistants are tasked with menial duties like copying, scanning, answering phones and emails, and many other tasks that may pop up anytime. The interview merely consisted of the Associate Director asking me questions about my international experience, office experience, language proficiency, and availability. It was very informal and easy.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.

title: Alumni Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and cover letter online. I heard back about the position via e-mail two days later to schedule and interview for the following week. The Director of Administrative Services went over the position and benefits with me, and was then interviewed by both them and the VP of Alumni Outreach. I was told I would hear back about the position within a week or two and if I hadn't heard anything by then to contact them. I heard back the following week.
Interview Questions: All questions were fairly standard. The interviewers seemed concerned that I would not find the job satisfying or challenging enough.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: What I've got was postdoc job, so I just did phone interview and quick test for my subject area. The job was pretty matching with my background and I was got hired.
Interview Questions: The question was all job related, nothing difficult to answer.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied as a web developer for one of the labs on campus. It was a very informal interview -- we mostly just talked about very high-level concepts and my past experience. There were not any technical questions, just simple stuff like which operating system did I prefer and why, etc. Very easy interview overall.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to accomplish here in your time?

title: Equipment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I posted my resume on Indeed.com.  The prospective employer saw it there and contacted me about an open position.  I can in for a face to face interview with  him and several colleagues.  We had lunch and a tour of the lab facilities.  I met with 4 other engineers.  I will be offered a job, but at a different pay scale
Interview Questions: Why do I want to join the center, for lower money

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I called the hiring officer toward the end of the job interview process. Good timing, it was about to close. I was called in for an interview the next day with the person who supervises the position. After speaking with that person, I was called back to meet the unit director. Very organized and thoughtful interviews.
Interview Questions: One thing they asked is what I know about Georgia Tech and its colleges, programs, etc.

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager found me on the LinkedIn and approached me. Had a very short phone interview. Then they flew me to California for an onsite interview. Had 10 one on one interviews with team members and HRs. Was asked behavior questions such as what is your weakness? What do you know about our company? etc.
Interview Questions: What is the effect of proportional / integral gain in a PID controller

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Look for the call for applicants in late December and then be mindful of the late January deadline. Submit a two-page job letter, CV, and Teaching Portfolio (the teaching portfolio should include qualitative and quantitative data); request for a Skype Interview, 30 minutes, 5 interviewers, questions range from research to teaching.
Interview Questions: How do you see your research connecting to your teaching?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I think the interview is challenging and exciting.
Interview Questions: How do you assign your time between work and life?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Went online and search for the contacting information for the professor I'm interested to work with. Sent him an email with my CV and he said he'll need to review all the potential candidates he got and he'll get back to me later. Then he got back to me directly with offer without any further interview process.
Interview Questions: He didn't ask me anything ....

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Since this was a graduate student position, you just apply online. After acceptance there is a recruitment event in which new potential graduate students get the opportunity to meet with senior grads/postdocs and advisors. Individual meetings are set up for advisors you are interested in. Generally you will meet with the advisor, and separately with their students. Expect to hear back pretty quickly (~1 week).
Interview Questions: What is your background in? Have you done undergraduate research? Which instruments are you familiar with?

title: Student Assistant - MSE Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my resume to the supervisor along with my schedule. She replied with a time to meet for an interview. The interview was pretty basic and the attendees included myself, my intended supervisor, and my supervisor's boss. They were both really friendly. Minimum questions were asked, and it was mostly small talk about school and managing that with work. It was a very easy interview.
Interview Questions: What is your gpa?

title: IT Hardware and Software Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was easy . All they wanted to know was whether I would be able to work for about 6 months and that's about it.
Interview Questions: Your experience with computers?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: a one-on-one interview between the applicant and a hiring manager. The interviewer will ask questions about the applicant's experience and skills, work history, availability, and the qualifications the company is seeking in the optimal candidate for the job
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Very relaxed, not really interview, more like just chatting between friends. Just talk to professor about my interest and plan for my graduate school in the future.
Then talked about course work, my knowledge background, programming experience etc.
Since this is not like job interview in industry, and I am already enrolled in the graduate school.
Interview Questions: What's your interest area

title: Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy, just behavorial questions.
Interview Questions: None.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was not too formal although I found they were very professional. They asked me for reference letters and also they asked me for my previous contributions in science.
Interview Questions: Most of the technical question where addressed to my previous job. I feel comfortable discussing my work so it was not a problem for me.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Going to the pool at campus recreation center; meeting with the head guards there, and one of them will show you around the facilities, and then sitting in the training room and talking with them. Then, talking with the manager. All the questions they asked will be behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How long have you been swimming? Are you a team player?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was good around all technical question on research and biology. Got hired same day. started first as volunteer but started salaried from next month. my PI is awesome. 1st day interview and then they just processed my hiring packet within 15 days.
Interview Questions: If I had special skills for the research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Mainly just behavioral questions
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a standard PhD application, I received a phone call without notification. The professor I wanted to work with (written in SOP) gave me a call. The professor asked me several questions including: why I chose the research lab, what I want to study, what I did during my MS.
Interview Questions: Have you had any programming experience?

title: Head Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basically they review your application, including your grades in 2030 and 2031. Then Dr. Collins will talk to you made sure you are OK. Then there will be a general meeting for new TAs and you can make up your mind then.
Interview Questions: There wasn't any difficult question

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Basic questions and aptitude.
Ability to work in the field and do Data entry
Be available on short notice and flexible with timings.
Ability to follow instructions set out and execute them . take readings and record them accurately
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There is nothing like an interview process, just apply for a PhD. The most important step is the qualifiers exam - both oral and written. Unless one aces the qualifiers exam, one is not formally admitted to a PhD program.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I took a test, diced an onion, talked about current news stories, described desserts and meals I have made.  Interviewer was nice even though I was nervous.  His employees seem to like him.  The kitchen was very clean and roomy.
Interview Questions: I was asked what my specialty is.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very typical. I submitted my application for the graduate school, including online application, recommendation letters, transcript. And then I received an email from my advisor to ask me if I am interested in his lab. I said yes!
Interview Questions: I was not asked a question

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Tech in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Simple enough interview process. This is especially true for postdocs. It was conducted over teleconference and phone. This can often be a reasonable way to gauge a lab you want to join, but pay special attention to what the existing lab personnel say.
Interview Questions: There was nothing that difficult or unexpected. The salary offer made was unexpectedly low though.

title: Graduate Research Assistant, CEE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applications for fall admission are typically due in late fall of the previous calender year (e.g. fall 2010 admissions close in December 2009, but check the department's webpage, as this can change from year-to-year). Candidates are invited to campus in the spring of the year. These students are accepted, but may not yet have a committed source of funding. Students meet with potential advisors (if they were not sponsored by a particular faculty member) or spend most of their time talking with a particular faculty member. There is typically a social event at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do a PhD?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: It's quite simple for international students. First apply online and send the supplemental materials to the school. While waiting for responses, email professors that you are interested in and communicate with them to impress them. That's it.
Interview Questions: Do you wanna join my research group?

title: Graduate Research Assistant, ChBE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, if accepted, Georgia Tech will invite you to a recruitment weekend to see the campus and meet with students and professors.
Interview Questions: What research area are you interested in?

title: Chemistry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: I networked with a previous professor who was taking sabbatical at Georgia Tech. He put me in touch with the research professor that I interviewed with and now work for. Networking is the best way to get into research at a major university! It also is how 80 percent of job offers are achieved.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was an individual interview why my future advisor. We went through my resume, my research experience, the reasons why I was interested in his research... He also asked me to give a little technical presentation abouthe previous work I have done.... He gave me an answer a couple of days after
Interview Questions: Tell me about one research project you worked on

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Rotational interviews with Professors who are looking for Ph.D and MS researchers
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in pursuing a Ph.D.?

title: Director, Research Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: As a State institution of higher education, Georgia Tech must post openings publicly for at least 30 days, typically on the Institute HR homepage. Everything is submitted electronically. If invited to interview for a director position, there is usually a phone interview first. If the applicant passes to the next stage, he then participates in a face-to-face interview with a group. If he is selected as the finalist, he receives an official offer letter and must respond with an official letter accepting or declining the position. The candidate has the option to call the hiring supervisor to discuss the terms of employment, possible start dates, relocation assistance, benefits, etc. Typically GT will allow some adequate time to relocate and start employment. (Of course, by state law, GT had to perform a criminal background check on me prior to offering me the position, but that is a fairly quick process.)
Interview Questions: How have you demonstrated your ability to work independently at a high level of productivity and initiative?

title: Production Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by phone Manager set up interview. 1st interview group - situational questions. 2nd interview group department staff questioned about likes and dislikes. Entire department was very laid back and nice
Interview Questions: What are you going to do if you get bored?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Met with the professor and his assistant
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you felt challenged in the workplace?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process, phone conversation that lead to a 1 on 1 chat. Lasted about 30 minutes. Asked questions about my background, why I was interested, what my previous experience was, and my potential schedule conflicts. Great job, and great people. Georgia Tech is a wonderful community.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and submitted alll the materials they asked for, including TOEFL, GRE, transcripts, resume, personal statement and also recommendation letters. After they went through the first background check, the professors who were interested in your background would contact you and asked you a few questions. If he/she is satisfied, you would get an offer from them.
Interview Questions: Here it requires solid mathematical background, are you confident in yours?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the professor I was interested in working with by email. Simultaneously I submitted the grad school application to the Prof's department, and specified his name as first choice. A while later (1-2 months) they contacted me to schedule an interview. The interview I met with 4 or 5 profs including my first choice. There were 10-15 other admitted prospective students. It was a pleasant process. My advisor did most of the talking during our meeting time. This was my first interview really so I was not particularly savvy about the questions I asked.
Interview Questions: (Incredulously) You've only taken X number of classes in your field of interest??

title: Peer Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: After applying there is two interviews.  The first is a group interview where they ask you to design activities as a team.  Here they are really looking at how you work with others.  Everyone tries to be a leader, but what really impresses people is letting others lead while still contributing to the team.  The second interview is a traditional interview with a Hall Director and a current Peer Leader.  Here they go into detail about your leadership experiences and ask what you would do in certain situations on the job
Interview Questions: They really like to know if you have first aid experience and will ask questions about it

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Had telephone interview with 2 senior people. Was then offered a trip down to interview in person. Spent the day interviewing with different people, including manager.  1 week later was told on offer would be coming.
Interview Questions: Describe past research and what you want to research in the future.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Had to communicate with individual professors separately, and see if I am a good fit for their research lab, and vice versa. Usually through emails. In many cases, there is no reply or a short reply, and the professors have very busy schedules.
Interview Questions: In my case, getting into the lab wasn't difficult. Mostly it's performing after I got in, and whether the professor thinks he should fund me or not based on my performance after a semester or two. It seems almost contractual every semester. I do not know for sure whether I will be kept as GRA, or whether I will be paid a different amount, each semester.

title: Senior Systems Support Engineer Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: most of the time the post the information on the web
Interview Questions: It is not difficult at all

title: Roll Call Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application the Roll Call Manager will call you; you must be an active student to be employed in the call center.  Once the phone interview is open, the first 3 days are considered training and then you go live.
Interview Questions: In the beginning learning to take the 'canned speech' and make it your own, or per the caller's intent of asking questions or receiving accurate information.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: An email was sent to all students. I attached my resume along with the email. After about 20 days I got an interview offer with a particular date and time. I prepared real hard on the semiconductor devices and also made a presentation on the current research topics of the prof. he was really impressed by this presentation.
Interview Questions: How would you see yourself in 2 years time?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions:
# Describe a situation in which you were able to use persuasion to successfully convince someone to see things your way.

# Describe a time when you were faced with a stressful situation that demonstrated your coping skills.

# Give me a specific example of a time when you used good judgment and logic in solving a problem.

# Give me an example of a time when you set a goal and were able to meet or achieve it.

# Tell me about a time when you had to use your presentation skills to influence someone's opinion.
Interview Questions: Give me a specific example of a time when you used good judgment and logic in solving a problem

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Tech (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: One phone screen and one technical interview
Interview Questions: Why Analog design as your specialization?
